```{r, eval = TRUE}
exp10 = function(x) 10^x
derived_params = 
  {
    tibble(
      mu_y = input$mu_y |> exp10(), 
      mu_b = input$mu_b |> exp10(), 
      gamma = input$gamma |> exp10(), 
      y0 = input$y0 |> exp10(),
      b0 = input$b0 |> exp10(),
      alpha = input$alpha |> exp10(),
      rho = input$rho,
      t1 = t1f(
        mu_y = mu_y,
        mu_b = mu_b, 
        gamma = gamma, 
        y0 = y0,
        b0 = b0),
      y1 = y1f(y0 = input$y0 |> exp10(), mu_y = mu_y, t1 = t1)
    ) 
  }|> reactive()



derived_params() |> renderTable(digits = 4)
```

```{r,fig.height=6}

plot1 = 
  {
    ggplot() + 
      geom_function(
        n = 1001,
        aes(col = "antibody"),
        fun = function(x) 
          antibody_decay_curve(
            t = x,
            mu_y = input$mu_y |> exp10(), 
            mu_b = input$mu_b |> exp10(), 
            gamma = input$gamma |> exp10(), 
            y0 = input$y0 |> exp10(),
            b0 = input$b0 |> exp10(),
            alpha = input$alpha |> exp10(),
            rho = input$rho
          ),
      ) + 
      geom_function(
        n = 1001,
        aes(col = "pathogen"),
        fun = function(x)
        {
          pathogen_decay_curve(
            t = x,
            mu_y = input$mu_y |> exp10(), 
            mu_b = input$mu_b |> exp10(), 
            gamma = input$gamma |> exp10(), 
            y0 = input$y0 |> exp10(),
            b0 = input$b0 |> exp10()
          )
        }) + 
      theme_bw() +
      labs(col = "") +
      theme(legend.position = "bottom") +
      xlim(0, 100) +
      # scale_x_log10(limits = c(.0001, 100)) +
      ylab("concentration") +
      xlab('time since infection (days)') +
      scale_y_continuous(
        # scale_y_log10(
        labels = scales::label_comma(),
        limits = c(
          10^-4,
          10^input$ylim
          # derived_params() |> pull(y1)
        )
      )
  } |> reactive()

plot1() |> 
  # renderPlot()
  plotly::ggplotly()  |>
  plotly::layout(legend = list(orientation = 'h')) |>
  plotly::renderPlotly()
```
